definition: land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc

sentences.english: His father was a wealth sugar planter and his mother came from the Cuban landed gentry.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸是富裕的甘蔗種植園主，媽媽來自古巴地主階級。

sentences.english: The clerk said with his best southern planter's accent.
sentences.chinese: 房間登記員以最地道的南部種植園主的口吻回答。

sentences.english: Why do they work on coffee plantations at all?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼他們還是要在咖啡種植園工作呢？

sentences.english: They owned vast banana plantations in Guatemala and Central America.
sentences.chinese: 他們在危地馬拉和中美洲擁有廣大的香蕉大種植園。

sentences.english: Legume cover crops must be planted, when new plantations are established.
sentences.chinese: 在新種植園建立時必須種植豆科保護作物。

sentences.english: In Yucatan they established the earliest known cocoa plantations.
sentences.chinese: 在尤卡坦半島，他們建立起早期的可可種植園。

sentences.english: It is also favourable for the present season the phytosanitary state of the plantations.
sentences.chinese: 這也有利於種植園進行當前季節的植物檢疫。

sentences.english: They also own about 40 hectares of coffee plantation.
sentences.chinese: 同時，他們也擁有約40公頃的咖啡種植園。

sentences.english: He was transferred to a field hospital at a nearby plantation to recover.
sentences.chinese: 他被轉送到種植園附近一家戰地醫院裏康復。

sentences.english: The Wilsons decided to farm ort their rubber plantation to the natives.
sentences.chinese: 威爾遜家決定把橡膠種植園出租給當地人。

sentences.english: He also distinguished himself as a planter in kenya.
sentences.chinese: 他也因是肯雅種植園主而聞名。

sentences.english: The plantations soak up radiation and prevent its spread to groundwater.
sentences.chinese: 種植園可以吸收輻射並防止其蔓延至地下水中。

sentences.english: Were there gipsies in the plantation at the time?
sentences.chinese: 那時吉普賽人在種植園裏嗎？

sentences.english: Not all plantation work has been masculinized.
sentences.chinese: 種植園裏的工作並非全是些男性化的工作。

sentences.english: To all appearances he was just the commonplace planter who had fallen upon evil days .
sentences.chinese: 表面上看來，他完全是個時運不濟的普通種植園主。

definition: to sell/to sell on commission/to distribute

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zhong1 xin1

definition: reinsurance (contractual device spreading risk between insurers)
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
